entry.title: Reland "[lacros-a11y]: add initial support for Ash-driven C++ Lacros SpokenFeedbackTests"
entry.content:
This reverts commit a7778153d17e0fe5f66ae95e7e0ebf9875a86541.



Reason for revert: Should be less flaky after crrev.com/c/4837376

which passes --disable-gpu and causes a11y JS test flakes to

drop from 40% to ~2%.



Original change's description:

> Revert "[lacros-a11y]: add initial support for Ash-driven C++ Lacros SpokenFeedbackTests"

>

> This reverts commit 11e9e3ec89f52f16f19e80a75580ed018b11fb21.

>

> Reason for revert:

> Speculative revert. This seems to be failing SpokenFeedbackTests on

> linux-chromeos-rel.

> https://ci.chromium.org/ui/p/chromium/builders/ci/linux-chromeos-rel/68038/overview

>

> Original change's description:

> > [lacros-a11y]: add initial support for Ash-driven C++ Lacros SpokenFeedbackTests

> >

> > This change adds the needed setup for SpokenFeedbackTests to launch a

> > Lacros browser whenever a url is opened.

> >

> > In addition, it adds a new helper `NavigateToUrl` which opens the given

> > url in either Lacros or Ash depending on whether the

> > `--lacros-chrome-path` got passed to Chrome (via AshBrowserTestStarter).

> >

> > Note that these tests could be driven by a Lacros binary (browser test)

> > if they get invoked (after a mojo IPC) and report back results with

> > minimal changes required and backward compat when run through an Ash

> > browser test.

> >

> > Finally, a subset of tests are left for follow ups (see

> > linux-chromeos.browser_tests.require_lacros.filter).

> >

> > Test: cq/try bots

> > Bug: none

> > Change-Id: I23865715af72e0c46ca7ac839aaffaeeeabaec5e

> > Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4707196

entry.title: IndexedDB: reroute quota checks through IndexedDBBucketContext
entry.content:
Rerouting these checks through IndexedDBBucketContext removes one more

dependency from the bucket sequence to the main sequence and allows

coalescing of quota checks.



* Coalescing checks (creating a queue that is drained with just one

trip to the quota manager thread) has the potential to reduce thread

hopping. This will also eliminate an existing race between quota

checks and transaction commits when multiple transactions

coexist. [1]



* We can take the opportunity to fudge the checks a little in order

to reduce the overhead required to write to the database. This will

improve performance for the use case of many small transactions at

the cost of potentially overstepping quota by at most

kAcceptableQuotaErrorMargin. See investigation in crbug.com/1436031

The algorithm being used here is to "remember" any excess quota for

a while, i.e. 30 seconds. The amount that the bucket context has

the authority to approve decays linearly over those 30 seconds.



* Pre-warm the bucket space cache, i.e. check the bucket space in the

quota manager when a transaction first puts a value, in addition

to when it commits (the commit check will have been cached most

likely)



[1] Because both transactions' quota checks may be processed before

the first transaction commits, the latter quota check would not

take into account the earlier transaction's disk usage.



Bug: 1474996,1436031

Change-Id: Iebd351db5b5480a5a9b5e2ca9e288388bff13859

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4857330

Commit-Queue: Evan Stade

Reviewed-by: Nathan Memmott

Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1197440}

entry.title: [ui-simplification] Update history WebUI icon.
entry.content:
Currently the history WebUI is using the schedule icon. For consistency

entry.title: Prepare to switch from StringPrintf() to time formatting utilities.
entry.content:
These will let us eliminate the hardcoded day and month names and

simplify caller code. However, they don't use an Exploded struct, so

replace adjusting by "1 year" to adjusting by "365 days", which can be

done by base::Time.



This may actually be more correct; for example, if the input is Feb. 29,

2004 (a valid leap day), the previous output would be Feb. 29, 2005 (an

invalid date).

entry.title: [iOS] Overflow Menu Customization accessibility improvements
entry.content:
This CL contains a few accessibility improvements:

1. For some reason, SwiftUI creates 2 NSItemProviders when VoiceOver

is enabled. This breaks the code that listens to when the "singular"

NSItemProvider is deallocated. Now, destinationDragHandler holds a weak

array of all providers, so it can tell when all have been deallocated.

2. Adding labels to the various toggles gives better voiceover behavior,

even though the labels are not displayed visually in the UI.

3. Added an accessibilityHint to the destination views so the user knows

that "activating" the view will hide it.

4. Combined a views into singular accessibility elements in a few

places.



Bug: 1463959

entry.title: Rename GetMaximizedOrCenteredWindowType
entry.content:
Rename GetMaximizedOrCenteredWindowType to GetWindowTypeOnMaximizable

inside WindowState and LockWindowState. Updated the corresponding

comments as well.

For the one inside `WindowState`, which is used in tablet mode and the

window will be centered if it is not maximizable. But for the one

inside LockWindowState, which is used in the lock screen. The window

will take the full work area even it is in normal state, no centered

related logic at all.

entry.title: base: Fix CanChangeThreadType unittest
entry.content:
The CanChangeThreadType unittest has several failures when run as root,

because as root, the nice value can be lowered (priority increased).



Fix these by detecting if the test is run as root.



Further, CanSetThreadTypeToRealtimeAudio() returns false for root which

also causes another test failure. Fix that by checking for root in

CanSetThreadTypeToRealtimeAudio() similar to CanLowerNiceTo().



Bug: b/262267726

Test: base_unittests --gtest_filter="*ProcessTest.*ThreadBackgrounding*"

entry.title: Add fast lookups for WebForm(Control)?Elements when using DOMNodeIds
entry.content:
This CL:

-Adds functions (Web)?Node::FromDomNodeId to create the corresponding

object given its DOMNodeId.

-Modified Autofill functions that search for an element given its ID

to use the introduced functions for efficiency.



The goal of this CL chain is to ultimately replace WebElements stored

in AutofillAgent with their DOMNodeIds, as this would resolve potential

memory leak problems. This will also get rid of UnireRendererId()

functions in blink as well ass the corresponding data member.

entry.title: [iOS] Modify presenting and dismissing sharing views
entry.content:
* Makes PasswordPickerVC and FamilyPickerVC be pushed instead of

presented if it's initialized on top of PasswordSharingVC (spinner)

without animation

* Makes FamilyPickerVC be pushed/popped instead of presented/dismissed

if it's initialized on top of PasswordPickerVC (with animation)

* Removes stopping PasswordPickerCoordinator when going between family

picker and password picker, FamilyPicker will be just pushed on top

(this way password picker will keep the user selection when going

between views and the animation will be in line with mocks)

This is to prevent the same unuploaded crash from being reported for

more than once.

entry.title: Lacros: Do not access profile via browser() in ash browser tests.
entry.content:
Currently AshBrowserTestStarter::StartLacros() opens an ash

browser window in addition to Lacros browser. This does not

make sense in LacrosOnly mode. However, some tests will fail

if we don't create ash browser, since they have dependency on

that which need to be fixed.



This cl refactors the test code to avoid accessing ash user profile

via browser().

entry.title: Create a disable_crashes parameter for the kMetricsReportingFeature.
entry.content:
We want to support uploading metrics and not crashes.

This currently only supports Windows.



The logic here is pretty odd and I don't really love it, but I don't wan to a big restructure in the middle of adding a new feature and it's not clearly wrong. The subtle thing here is there is 2 things used on the crash side, the registry key (which the logic here is setting the Feature being on) and also the consent parameter (which currently includes both consent,the feature, and other ideas).



We decided to just include this parameter for the registry key part and not include it in the consent parameter since it isn't related to consent. This is still functional since both are checked.



We tested end to end on a local windows build.



Change-Id: I0f1d429a240e07e73cd9c934846f2cc675dc8db2

entry.title: [APS] Limit optional button tooltip and hover highlight only to profile, share, voice search and new tab
entry.content:
- Add new fields(tooltipTextResId,showHoverhighlight) in ButtonData#ButtonSpec and ButtonDataImpl to control whether we show tooltip or hover highlight for a specific ButtonVariant. The tooltip and hover highlight is set in OptionalButtonView#updateButtonWithAnimation

- Add tooltip text for share, voice search and new tab. Currently no tooltip text for profile because a11y team doesn't want us to change the a11y string.

- Add hover highlight for share, voice search, new tab and profile

may unintentially create copies. Change

WebAccessibleResourcesInfo::IsResourceWebAccessible() to take a const T*

pointer param instead. Then update all the callers and some of the

signatures up the caller chain, where the parameter flip-flops between

const absl::optional& and const T*.

entry.title: [dPWA] Fix heap UAF in WebAppUninstallDialogView
entry.content:
There is an UAF triggered in WebAppUninstallDialogView where uninstall

with a ScopedKeepAlive wipes out the dialog view, leading to a UAF in

the checkbox_ stored in the dialog view. There might be other

concerns as well about clearing web app site data breaking, since that

is called after the checkbox_ is accessed.



This CL fixes that by:

1. Storing the information about checkbox before triggering uninstall,

and ensuring that Uninstall is the last call happening.

2. Moving the logic to clear web app site data to the caller. This

allows the site clearing logic to be tied to the ScopedKeepAlive

callback, allowing site clearing to happen before the keep alive

destructs, thus preventing any possible UAFs.



Bug: 1481063

Change-Id: Ic96b29cc45e54b00a7ae4faf85f727b36d869d02

entry.title: Reland "Create a handle system for UI objects."
entry.content:
This reverts commit e6146531d33ec7a7e532389d73ed442cc0093d96.



Reason for revert: Fixing issue with tests.



Original change's description:

> Revert "Create a handle system for UI objects."

>

> This reverts commit cc955e7eb870a1cd2f21fae842dc6dec18f22178.

>

> Reason for revert: Newly-added tests are failing on linux-ubsan-vptr; first failing build:

> https://ci.chromium.org/ui/p/chromium/builders/ci/linux-ubsan-vptr/25597

> (Looks like the static_cast in supports_handled.h:207 is invalid?)

>

> Original change's description:

> > Create a handle system for UI objects.

> >

> > An object that |SupportsHandles| allows you to call GetHandle() to return a handle to that object. Handles are opaque objects that are serializable but from which the original object can be retrieved if it still exists.

> >

> > The integral type for the opaque handle may be specified in order to ensure adequate bits for the rolling counter, and the behavior when the counter rolls over can also be specified. The fact that rollover is possible is the major disadvantage vs. |WeakPtr|, which is almost always the better choice if you do not need serializability.

> >

> > This is a prerequisite for a lot of stability work we are doing in

> > the tabstrip model and related systems.

> >

entry.title: Restack resize shadow after floating animation
entry.content:
This cl fixed the issue that when floating a window by multi-task

menu, the resize shadow will be stacked above the window.



The root cause is due to the cross fade animation while floating

a window. Detailed process is shown below.



When float a window, there is a cross fade animation. The cross

fade animation recreates the window layer and stacks the new layer

below the old layer. The layers from top to bottom are:

- old layer

- new layer

- shadow layer



At the same time, since multitask menu is closed, focus manager

brings the window on top, so both new layer and resize shadow

layer are restacked:

- new layer

- shadow layer

- old layer



Finally, cross fade animation brings the new layer with smaller

size below the old layer with larger size. However, the shadow

layer is not restacked.

- shadow layer

- old layer

- new layer



After the old layer is destroyed, the new window layer is beneath

the shadow layer.

- shadow layer

- new layer



The cl fixed this issue by restacking the shadow after cross fade

animation.



Test: ResizeShadowAndCursorTest.KeepShadowBeneathFloatWindow

Bug: b:300297295

Change-Id: I3dc21f8154b887bc42aff622533c2e8e07b1e31e

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4863508

entry.title: Android: Prevent unnecessary runtime exception
entry.content:
When a 32/64 combination bundle is installed on a 64-bit only emulator,

there is a RuntimeException that alerts the dev that this combination

does not work and a target name with _64 in it needs to be used instead.

This exception can be hard to spot as currently a second exception is

printed due to CommandLine being used before initialized.



Avoid the second exception by guarding the use of CommandLine so that

there is only one RuntimeException in the logcat.



Example of the second exception:

Process: org.chromium.chrome:launch_failed, PID: 6607

java.lang.AssertionError

at org.chromium.base.CommandLine.getInstance(CommandLine.java:128)

at org.chromium.components.crash.PureJavaExceptionReporter.createReportFile(PureJavaExceptionReporter.java:153)



Bug: 1303857

Change-Id: Id7e0b7b616d790bbafb9af21abfc5b6363ff8350

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4867087

entry.title: updater: simplify the installer result semantics
entry.content:
This CL simplifies the installer results down to "success" or "error".

The behavior for these two classes of results are now uniform:

* For all success cases:

- if a launch command was provided via the installer API, the command

will be launched and the updater UI will exit silently. Otherwise,

the updater will show an install success dialog.



* For all error cases:

- if an installer error was not provided via the installer API or the

exit code, generic error `kErrorApplicationInstallerFailed` will be

reported.

- the installer extra code is used if reported via the installer API.

- the text description of the error is used if reported via the

installer API.



Also updated the functional spec.



Fixed: 1483053

Change-Id: Ia364dc995a23658bb0efb6611b2343449054d3ce

entry.title: base: Stop using basic_string<T> for non-standard T
entry.content:
libc++ is removing basic_string<> support for types that aren't

char, wchar_t, char8_t, char16_t, char32_t.



So check for these types explicitly.



The only user of basic_string with non-standard T in base is

IsContiguousIterator<>, and that is exclusively used to

EnableIf<> a span(iterator> ctor. So the effect of this is that

after it, you can no longer make a span(str.begin()) if str is

e.g. a basic_string or basic_string. But

since those aren't allowed and soon won't work, that's ok.



(A presubmit complained about char8_t. Since this here tries to

mimic the standard library, an exception is probably fine. If it

causes issues due to C++20, we can put it behind a __cplusplus version

check once we've seen the problems.)



Bug: 1481891,1483265

entry.title: Android: Better error messages for ABI mismatch
entry.content:
Instead of relying on catapult or adb to raise errors, most of which are

not easily translated to an ABI mismatch issue, manually filter devices

in apk_operations.py in order to provide informative error messages when

there are no valid devices to install a given apk or bundle. Some

combinations are listed below, as well as whether they work or have an

error message.



Example devices (ABI lists via ro.product.cpu.abilist):

- emulator API 28 for x86 device, supports: ['x86', 'armeabi-v7a', 'armeabi']

- filtered to just ['x86']

- emulator API 33 for x64 device, supports: ['x86_64']

- pixel 4A for arm64 device, supports: ['arm64-v8a', 'armeabi-v7a', 'armeabi']



Example: Installing trichrome_chrome_bundle with target_cpu="arm" to x86 device

Exception: Cannot find any supported devices for this app.



The device (serial=emulator-5554) is not supported because none of the app's ABIs (arm64-v8a,armeabi-v7a) match this device's ABIs (x86), you may need to set target_cpu="x86" in your args.gn.

entry.title: graphite: Remove unnecessary Metal WaitUntilCommandsScheduled
entry.content:
The WaitUntilCommandsScheduled call shows up in Instruments System Trace

as one of the top syscalls that blocks the GPU main thread for up to 1ms

or more. There are old comments indicating that this call is needed for

correct synchronization between Dawn and ANGLE Metal, but it's likely

that all those issues should be addressed by the shared event wait fix:

https://crrev.com/c/4312900



Skip the WaitUntilCommandsScheduled call when ANGLE Metal is used.

entry.title: [Nearby Presence] Add PublicCredentialType mojom conversion.
entry.content:
To facilitate passing the ::nearby::presence::PublicCredentialType enum

as a parameter to mojo interfaces, this CL adds a conversion to a new

::ash::nearby::presence::proto::mojom::PublicCredentialType enum.



PublicCredentialType is used to denote whether a PublicCredential

is considered remote or local. It is used as a parameter when

saving and querying for Nearby Presence credentials over the

`nearby_presence_credential_storage.mojom` interface.



A full design for Nearby Presence Credential

Storage can be found at go/cros-nearby-presence-credential-storage

entry.title: Handling Background Image Loading Failures and Reloading in Alignment with Image Tag Behavior
entry.content:
When the background-image is initially loaded and fails, resetting the background-image with the same URL will not trigger a reload.

In this case, it is necessary to also check the result of loading the image.

If it fails, the image should be reloaded if the same URL is encountered again, aligning with the behavior of the img tag.

entry.title: Port featured.FeatureLibraryLateBoot Tast test to Crosier
entry.content:
This test exercises the ChromeOS platform-level experiments framework,

which is implemented in a helper library called "featured" used by

platform components that want to handle Finch experiments.



- Launch featured.FeatureLibraryLateBoot.check helper binary to get its

view of feature state

- Collect app output on a worker thread, because the helper binary calls

back into chromeos_integration_tests over D-Bus, so collecting output

on the main thread causes a deadlock

- Use a list of test cases to describe the expected JSON output from the

helper binary for each experiment scenario



Tast source:

https://source.chromium.org/chromiumos/chromiumos/codesearch/+/main:src/platform/tast-tests/src/go.chromium.org/tast-tests/cros/local/bundles/cros/featured/feature_library_late_boot.go

Test: chromeos_integration_tests

entry.title: [Nearby] Fix utility process crash in stream classes.
entry.content:
Fixes a crash in OutputStreamImpl caused by accessing

|write_waitable_event_| after it has been reset. This is an apparent

race condition between the logic in Write() and the call to

base::WaitableEvent::Signal() in DoClose().



This also fixes the same issue in InputStreamImpl.



Test: Regression tested on Atlas, unit tests still pass.

entry.title: Extend interface for debugging
entry.content:
Add flag Chrome->Daemon and collected health data to Daemon->Chrome.



Until now, it was included in part of the request/responses, with

collected data only showing up in upload request.

That made it impossible to deliver the health data update unless there

is a new upload.

Now it will deliver data with Enqueue, ReportSuccess and Flush

responses, and flag will be added to everywhere too (although this is

less important).

entry.title: [iOS] Add egtests for skipped optional History Sync Opt-In
entry.content:
The history sync promo should not be shown too frequently to the users.

In the flow for which history sync is optional, the opt-in screen should

be skipped if any user declined it in the past 2 weeks, or twice in a

row.



This CL add few EGtests for the prompt triggered in Recent Tabs (where

the History Sync Opt-In step is mandatory), and in the settings (where

the step is optional). It also extract few matchers for the History Sync

UI to facilitate testing.
